adjective.description: (especially of a muscle or someone's body) stretched tight or rigid.
examples: she tried to relax her tense muscles

verb.description: Become tense, typically through anxiety or nervousness.

noun.description: A set of forms taken by a verb to indicate the time (and sometimes also the continuance or completeness) of the action in relation to the time of the utterance.

origin: Middle English (in the general sense time): from Old French tens, from Latin tempus time.
